com.googlecode.sarasvati.rubric
Class RubricCompiler

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.sarasvati.rubric.RubricCompiler

public class RubricCompiler
extends Object

Rubric is a simple rules language. It has the following grammar: 

 STMT = 'if' EXPR 'then' STMT 'else' STMT
      | Accept | Discard | Skip | Skip ARCNAME
      | digit
      | "quoted string"
      | '(' DATEFUNCTION ')'
      | '(' NUMBER (hour|hours|day|days|week|weeks) (before|after) DATEFUNCTION ')'

 EXPR = PREDICATE
      | PREDICATE 'or' EXPR
      | PREDICATE 'and' EXPR
      | 'not' EXPR
      | '(' EXPR ')'

 PREDICATE = ID
 DATEFUNCTION = ID
 ID = (letter)(letter|digit|'.')*  // letter followed by 0 to many letters, digits or dots
A predicate used in an expression is evaluated with the help of a RubricEnv. Specifically, the method PredicateEnv.evalPredicate(String) is called to evaluated a predicate.

Date functions work much the same way, except they are evaluated used the RubricEnv.evalDateFunction(String) method which returns a Date.

A Rubric statement used in a guard might look something like 

 if Order.isExpedite then Accept else Skip
A Rubric statement used in generating a task due date might look like 
   if Order.isExpedite then (2 days before standardInterval) else (standardInterval)

Author:
Paul Lorenz

Method Detail

compile

public static RubricStmt compile(String rubricStatement)
                          throws RubricException
Takes a Rubric program and returns a compiled version in the form of an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST). The AST can be executed/evaluated with a call to RubricStmt.eval(RubricEnv) or the AST can be traversed using a RubricVisitor with call to RubricStmt.traverse(RubricVisitor).

Parameters:
rubricStatement - A String containing a Rubric program
Returns:
A RubricStmt, which is the root of the compiled AST.
Throws:
RubricException - Thrown if the program is not valid.
